messages: 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:06): I wonder if that X3D activity is a response to canvas3d
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:07): it's like the SVG of 3D
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:07): except, I suspect, worse
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:07): I think it evolved from VRML
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (03:08): worse the svg?
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (03:08): hides
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:14): 042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427: It is indeed evolved from VRML
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:15): You can express it in 'classic' VRML syntax as well as in XML syntax
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:15): two syntaxes for a format that's not even really deployedyet
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:16): There's quite a number of independent implementations
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:16): If you're careful, you can even write a scene that works in at least two implementations
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:17): (It's also an ISO standard)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:17): aaah, why are we talking about x3d
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:17): tries to get to a safe place
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:18): I'm not sure X3D is particularly crazy or anything
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:18): but why did it come up!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:18): actually i know nothing about 3d
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:18): Because I saw http://www.web3d.org/x3d/wiki/index.php/X3D_and_HTML5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:18): though people seem to keep asking me about stuff to do with it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:19): (and because somebody emailed me about the X3D-in-canvas3d prototype I wrote ~16 months ago)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:19): jesus, everybody and their dog wants to put their vocabulary in html5
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: You've added lots of other things into HTML5 you know nothing about :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:20): i'm confident in saying that i know more about everything in html5 than i do about 3d anything
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:20): but that admittedly doesn't raise the bar very high
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:20): 3D is just like 2D, except in a different direction
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:21): 2D doesn't have things like lights
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:21): and cameras
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:21): Depending on your level of abstraction, 3D doesn't have those either :-)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:22): Cameras are just transformation matrices, and lights are just vectors you feed into your shaders, and it's easy when you copy-and-paste the scary maths from somewhere
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:22): woosh
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:22): I'm sure it's easier to understand than <keygen> :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:23): actually <keygen> was easy to understand, it just wasn't documented
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): i wonder how we should allow people to annotate their HTML documents with a datetime representing the last substantial update
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:24): (or if we should not)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:25): Sounds like a job for the microdata hammer
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (03:25): one existing solution: they could use hAtom to markup the page as an entry with an "updated" datetime.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:27): i don't want to make html5 hardcode any magical class values; last time i did that i got yelled at so much it had to be removed :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:28): would wonder what a "substantial update" is, but decides instead to go to bed
f5af272b5b04154c260eec46f4deb905 (03:28): no need to hardcode any magical class values in html5 - simply don't bother to solve the problem in html5 and let people use the existing solution
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:28): this is actually part of some other problem i'm solving
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:29): (namely adding Atom as one of the formats you can export to in http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#converting-html-to-other-formats )
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:35): I was quite clearly to say "not really deployed" instead of "not implemented"
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:35): I was quite *careful*
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (03:35): I wish I knew another language so I could pretend English wasn't my first language
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:35): i wonder if the x3d-in-html5 effort is related to the people who asked me if collada could be put in html5 <canvas> recently

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:36): if <article pubdate=""> gives the datetime that the article was published, what would be a good attribute name for the datetime that the article was last modified?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:37): (or alternatively, what would be good attribute names for published datetime and updated datetime respectively; it doesn't have to be pubdate)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:44): eh screw it, i'll just have only pubdate
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:44): oh hey, updates can already be annoted using <ins>/<del>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:45): so i can just get the date from that
